byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Pentagon believes hundreds of additional trainers, commandos and advisers from United States and its allies will have to be sent to Iraq and Syria over coming months to battle and beat Islamic State; military officials tell Pres Obama's national security team that significant progress has been achieved against ISIS, but more is needed to defeat group.
lead_paragraph: To deal a lasting blow to the extremist Sunni militancy, officials believe that additional forces will be needed to work with Iraqi, Kurdish and Syrian opposition fighters.

headline.main: More Is Needed to Beat ISIS, Pentagon Officials Conclude
headline.print_headline: More Is Needed to Beat ISIS, Military Concludes

snippet: To deal a lasting blow to the extremist Sunni militancy, officials believe that additional forces will be needed to work with Iraqi, Kurdish and Syrian opposition fighters.
